definition: to flee from danger/to avoid danger/to minimize risk/(finance) hedge
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from

sentences.english: Interestingly, forex markets haven't followed equities into this risk-off mode.
sentences.chinese: 有意思的是，外汇市场并未跟随股市进入避险模式。

sentences.english: Custody banks are winning lots of hedge-fund business as a result of this.
sentences.chinese: 结果，信讬银行因此赢得许多笔避险基金的交易。

sentences.english: High oil price era has ended, gold is still a relatively safe haven asset.
sentences.chinese: 高油价时代已结束，黄金仍是较为稳健的避险资产。

sentences.english: Then there was the collapse of the Long-Term Capital Management hedge fund in 1998.
sentences.chinese: 接下来是1998年的长期资本管理避险基金的崩盘。

sentences.english: Residents living on Yeonpyeong Island have been told to evacuate or take shelter.
sentences.chinese: 延平岛上的居民已被告知撤离该岛或躲入掩体避险。

sentences.english: US hedge funds don't have to register as investment advisers with the SEC now.
sentences.chinese: 美国避险基金如今不必向证管会登记为投资顾问。

sentences.english: The dollar has been trading in-and-out of being a growth currency and a safe haven currency.
sentences.chinese: 美元一直在成长货币和避险货币角色之间转换。

sentences.english: One of them was, would you buy insurance against such and such a risk?
sentences.chinese: 其中一个问的是，你会通过购买保险来避险吗？

sentences.english: The defensive necessity is to counter-attack the danger source.
sentences.chinese: 防御性紧急避险是针对危险源本身所实施的避险。

sentences.english: The defensive necessity is to counter-attack the danger source.
sentences.chinese: 防御性紧急避险是针对危险源本身所实施的避险。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the Swiss franc - another popular haven currency - weakened against the euro.
sentences.chinese: 同时，另一种避险货币瑞士法郎对欧元走低。

sentences.english: At times, that stemmed from gold's safe-haven status as other asset classes tumbled.
sentences.chinese: 有时源于其他资产下跌时黄金的避险地位。

sentences.english: Therefore, separate hedging used by bank will militate against operation performance.
sentences.chinese: 因此，单独使用避险将不利于银行经营业绩。

definition: (of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
abbr. for 期貨合約|期货合约[qi1 huo4 he2 yue1], futures contract (finance)
hot money, money flowing from one currency to another in the hope of quick profit
